a.xlink:title: Closes and re-initializes the zwapi_connection to the Z-Wave module.
Closes and re-initializes the zwapi_session to the Z-Wave module.
Send data frame to Z-Wave chip via serial port and wait for ACK.
Verifies that the command is supported by the Z-Wave module.
Send data frame to Z-Wave chip via serial API, wait for ACK and a RES frame.
Abort the ongoing transmit started with zwapi_send_data() or zwapi_send_data_bridge()
Add any type of node to the network.
Add any type of node to the network and accept prekit inclusion.
Create a new primary controller.
Disable the Watchdog.
Enable the Watchdog.
Lock and unlock a response route for a specific node.
Remove any type of node from the network.
Send command completed to primary controller.
Start neighbor discovery for bNodeID.
Sends TX status, TX report and session ID of the ongoing protocol command class encryption session to...
Create and transmit a "Node Information" frame.
Set ApplicationNodeInformation data to be used in subsequent calls to zwapi_send_node_information().
Remove all Nodes and timers from the EEPROM memory.
Sets the Application Node Information data for all virtual nodes owned by the Z-Wave API Module.
Sets the desired Z-Wave Long Range Channel configuration.
Reset the Z-Wave module.
Enable Watchdog and start kicking it in the Z-Wave chip.
Transfer the role as primary controller to another controller.
Makes sure that the Z-Wave API is not performing any network management operation.
Callback function for requesting protocol Command Class encryption.
Set the application part of the node information frame (NIF).
Initialize the Z-Wave Rx component.
Get zwave_api initialization data from the remote side (Enhanced Z-Wave module).
Refresh the whole zwapi_chip_data_t structure from the Z-Wave module.
Retrieves versioning data from the Z-Wave API Module.
Reads the currently configured Z-Wave Long Range Channel.
Read the number of bytes from the EEPROM.
Copy the number of bytes to the EEPROM.
Send a command to the Z-Wave module and waits for an ACK.
Configure whether zwapi_send_data callbacks should contain tx_status report information.
Refresh the node list from the Z-Wave protocol and copy in into the node_list pointer.
This function check if the NCP firmware should be updated.
Copy the number of bytes to the EEPROM and waits for Z-Wave module callback before returning.
Assign static return routes within a Routing End Node.
Set the NLS State of the node in the controller NVM.
Enable the SUC functionality in a controller.
Transmit a request for exclusion via an explore frame.
Transmit a request for inclusion via an explore frame.
Get the latest value of the background RSSI.
Get capabilities of a controller.
Get the Z-Wave Long Range radio channel in use.
Get Z-Wave Long Range node list in ZW_LR_NODEMASK_OFFSET offset of zwave_nodemask_t.
Get the maximum payload size allowed for sending frames in Z-Wave Long Range.
Get the current MAX Long Range TX power level in effect.
Get the maximum payload size allowed for sending frames in Z-Wave.
Get the NLS State of the nodes of a network in the controller NVM.
Get the NLS State of the node in the controller NVM.
Read out neighbor information.
Get the Last Working Route (LWR) for a destination node if any exist.
Copy the Node's current protocol information from the non-volatile memory.
Generate a random byte using the random number generator (RNG) on the Z-Wave module.
Generate an array of random bytes using the random number generator (RNG) on the Z-Wave module.
Get the current power level used in RF transmitting.
Get the current RF region.
Get the currently registered SUC node ID.
Get the current TX power level in effect.
Request nodemask containing virtual nodes in controller bridge.
Get the Z-Wave library type.
Get the Z-Wave library basis version.
Report the status of the Z-Wave protocol.
Check if a node is in the failed nodes table.
Get the current state of pti.
Read one byte from the EEPROM.
Get the Home ID and Node ID of the Z-Wave module.
Add one byte to the EEPROM write queue.
Close the NVM (restart the radio) after a read or write operation.
Open the NVM (stops the radio) before read or write operation.
Read a chunk of the 500-series NVM or 700-series NVM3.
Write a chunk of the 500-series NVM or 700-series NVM3.
Get a value from the NVR flash page.
Remove a node from the failed node list, if it already exist.
Request node information from a node.
Send data to a Z-Wave node or to the broadcast destination.
Transmit data buffer to a single ZW-node or all ZW-nodes (broadcast) in bridge mode.
Send data to a list of Z-Wave Nodes (multicast frame).
Send data to a list of Z-Wave Nodes (multicast frame) in bridge mode.
Sends a NOP to a NodeID destination.
Send protocol data to a Z-Wave node.
Send a test frame to specified NodeID.
